org.sakaiproject.taggable.api

Interface TaggingManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaggingManagerImpl

    public interface TaggingManager
    The TaggingManager provides access to available TaggableActivityProducers and TaggingProviders and the various activities and tags they provide.
    Author:
    The Sakai Foundation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String APPLICATION_ID
      String for the application id.
      static String LINK_REF
      String to identify link references.

      • SECURE_MODIFY_LINKS_FROM

        static final String SECURE_MODIFY_LINKS_FROM
        Security lock for modifying links. Checked in activity context and requires goal context counterpart.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final String SECURE_MODIFY_LINKS_TO
        Security lock for modifying links. Checked in goal context and requires activity context counterpart.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final String SECURE_LOCK_LINKS
        Security lock for locking links. Checked in activity context.

    • Method Detail

      • findProducerById

        TaggableActivityProducer findProducerById(String id)
        Method to get a taggable activity producer by identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique producer identifier.
        Returns:
        A taggable activity producer.

      • findProducerByRef

        TaggableActivityProducer findProducerByRef(String ref)
        Method to get the taggable activity producer that handles this reference.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to an object provided by a taggable activity producer.
        Returns:
        A taggable activity producer.

      • findProviderById

        TaggingProvider findProviderById(String id)
        Method to get a tagging provider by identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique provider identifier.
        Returns:
        A tagging provider.

      • registerProducer

        void registerProducer(TaggableActivityProducer producer)
        Method for a taggable activity producer to register itself with the tagging manager.
        Parameters:
        producer - A taggable activity producer.

      • registerProvider

        void registerProvider(TaggingProvider provider)
        Method for a tagging provider to register itself with this tagging manager.
        Parameters:
        provider - A tagging provider.

      • getContext

        String getContext(String ref)
        Method to get the context of the object represented by this reference.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference for an object produced by a taggable activity producer.
        Returns:
        The context of the referenced object.

      • getActivities

        List<TaggableActivity> getActivities(String context,
                                   TaggingProvider provider)
        Method to get a list of all taggable activities within the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to search.
        provider - The provider that is getting the activities. This allows the producers to selectively return different lists of activities depending on the given provider.
        Returns:
        A list, possibly empty, of all taggable activities within the given context that are accessible by the given tagging provider.

      • getActivity

        TaggableActivity getActivity(String activityRef,
                           TaggingProvider provider)
        Method to get a taggable activity by reference string.
        Parameters:
        activityRef - A reference for the taggable activity.
        provider - The provider that is getting the activity. This allows the producer to selectively return an activity, or none at all, depending on the given provider.
        Returns:
        The taggable activity, or null if no such activity exists or the provider cannot access it.

      • getProducers

        List<TaggableActivityProducer> getProducers()
        Method to get a list of the currently registered taggable activity producers.
        Returns:
        List of taggable activity producers.

      • getProviders

        List<TaggingProvider> getProviders()
        Method to get a list of the currently registered tagging providers.
        Returns:
        List of tagging providers.

      • getItem

        TaggableItem getItem(String itemRef,
                   TaggingProvider provider,
                   boolean getMyItemOnly,
                   String taggedItem)
        Method to get a taggable item by reference string.
        Parameters:
        itemRef - The reference for the taggable item.
        provider - The provider that is getting the item. This allows the producer to selectively return an item, or none at all, depending on the given provider.
        getMyItemsOnly - This flag will return only items where the owner matches userId
        taggedItem - Reference to an item that can be used for additional permission lookups
        Returns:
        The taggable item, or null if no such item exists or the provider cannot access it.

      • getItems

        List<TaggableItem> getItems(String activityRef,
                          TaggingProvider provider,
                          boolean getMyItemsOnly,
                          String taggedItem)
        Method to get a list of taggable items for the activity identified by the given activity reference.
        Parameters:
        activityRef - The reference for the taggable activity.
        provider - The provider that is getting the items. This allows the producers to selectively return different lists of items for the referenced activity depending on the given provider.
        getMyItemsOnly - This flag will return only items where the owner matches userId
        taggedItem - Reference to an item that can be used for additional permission lookups
        Returns:
        A list, possibly empty, of taggable items.

      • isTaggable

        boolean isTaggable()
        Method to determine if there are any tagging providers available.
        Returns:
        True if a tagging provider is available, false otherwise.

      • addLink

        Link addLink(String activityRef,
           String tagCriteriaRef,
           String rationale,
           String rubric,
           boolean visible)
             throws PermissionException
        Method to add a new link. A RuntimeException will be thrown if the goal set of the given goal is not published (see GoalSet#isPublished()).
        Parameters:
        activityRef - A reference for the activity to which this link is being created.
        tagCriteriaRef - The tagCriteriaRef to which this link is being created. It must belong to a published parent.
        rationale - The rationale for creating this link.
        rubric - Some rubric value.
        visible - True if this link should be made visible to those with appropriate permissions, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The link that has been added, or null on error.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - Exception thrown if current user doesn't have permission to perform this action.

      • addLink

        Link addLink(String activityRef,
           String tagCriteriaRef,
           String rationale,
           String rubric,
           boolean visible,
           boolean locked)
             throws PermissionException
        Method to add a new link.
        Parameters:
        activityRef - A reference for the activity to which this link is being created.
        tagCriteriaRef - The tagCriteriaRef to which this link is being created. It must belong to a published parent.
        rationale - The rationale for creating this link.
        rubric - Some rubric value.
        visible - True if this link should be made visible to those with appropriate permissions, false otherwise.
        locked - True if this link should be made locked to those with appropriate permissions, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The link that has been added, or null on error.
        Throws:
        PermissionException - Exception thrown if current user doesn't have permission to perform this action in the given context.
